headline: StandardAero Set to Join S&P MidCap 400
summary: StandardAero Inc. (NYSE: SARO) will replace Frontier Communications Parent Inc. (NASD: FYBR) in the S&P MidCap 400 effective prior to the opening of trading on Thursday, January 22. S&P 500 & S&P 100 constituent Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE: VZ) is acquiring Frontier Communications Parent in a deal expected to close soon pending final conditions.

headline: Stock Market Today: S&P 500, Dow Slide As Netflix, GE Aerospace Earnings Loom (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes fell Friday as Wall Street looked ahead to a three-day weekend. Among movers, obesity drug stock Novo Nordisk and PNC Financial Services each jumped on the stock market today.

headline: Verizon’s Outage Rebates Could Total $650 Million. The Dividend Costs Far More.
summary: In the wake of a nationwide outage to its wireless service,  Verizon  Communications has offered account credits of $20.  Verizon hasn’t confirmed the number of accounts affected by the outage, and it didn’t respond to Barron’s request for comment.  If each of Verizon’s roughly 32 million consumer postpaid wireless accounts get a credit, it would work out to a $647 million one-time cost for the company.

headline: Pentagon Deal Sends AST SpaceMobile Soaring—Is This the Next Leg Up?
summary: Shares of AST SpaceMobile surged on Friday after the company announced it was rewarded a government contract as part of the Golden Dome project.

headline: Why Verizon Wireless Customers Are Getting $20 Payouts—As Long as They Remember To Claim Them
summary: Verizon Communications said Thursday that customers who were affected by Wednesday's cell service outage can redeem a $20 account credit through their Verizon account.

headline: Does a Major Disruption Like Wednesday’s Verizon Outage Even Move the Needle for VZ Stock? What You Need to Know.
summary: One of the top stories on Wednesday is a massive Verizon outage that caused customers to be unable to make calls or receive messages across the U.S. But does this actually affect the VZ stock price?

headline: VZ Wins Regulatory Nod for Frontier Buyout: Will it Boost Prospects?
summary: VZ wins approval for $20B Frontier deal, expanding fiber reach to 30M+ passings and opening cross-selling that could reshape growth prospects.

headline: Stock Markets Can Learn From Trump’s Iran Pause. Why It’s Key for Investors.
summary: Taiwan companies offer U.S. chip investment for lower tariffs, Goldman sees possible opportunities in prediction markets, Verizon offering $20 credits after resolving service outage, and more news to start your day.

headline: Verizon blames software hiccup for outage. Growing tech complexity and ‘telecom arrogance’ could be bigger culprits.
summary: Verizon blames software hiccup for outage. Growing tech complexity and ‘telecom arrogance’ could be bigger culprits.

headline: Stocks With Juicy Dividends Are Tempting. But How Risky Are They?
summary: If the dividend yield exceeds the bond yield, it’s a sign that bond investors are comfortable with a company’s creditworthiness and that the dividend is relatively safe.

headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Find Risky
summary: The $10-50 price range often includes mid-sized businesses with proven track records and plenty of growth runway ahead. They also usually carry less risk than penny stocks, though they’re not immune to volatility as many lack the scale advantages of their larger peers.
